alert.note: Alert for Craig; Giles; Montgomery; Pulaski (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Pulaski, Giles, southwestern Craig, northwestern Montgomery, Summers, eastern Mercer and Monroe Counties and the northeastern City of Radford through 545 PM EDT... At 458 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Athens to near Lindside to Newport. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall. Cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized minor flooding possible in areas of poor drainage and low-lying areas. Ponding of water on roads and highways likely. Locations impacted include... Blacksburg... Radford... Princeton... Pearisburg... Hinton... Narrows... and Pembroke. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
